flask_scheema.services.database.apply_order_by(args_dict: Dict, query: Query, base_model: callable) → Query[source]¶

Applies order_by conditions to a query. Use “-” prefix for descending order. Example: “-id,name”

Parameters:

  • args_dict (dict) – Dictionary containing filtering and pagination conditions.

  • query (Query) – The query to sort.

  • base_model (Base) – The base model for the query.

Returns:

The sorted query.

Return type:

Query

flask_scheema.services.database.apply_pagination(query: Query, page: int = 0, limit: int = 20) → list[Any][source]¶

Paginates a given query.

Parameters:

  • query (Query) – Original SQLAlchemy query.

  • page (int) – Page number for pagination.

  • limit – Number of items per page.

Convert the given string value to its appropriate type based on the provided column_type.

flask_scheema.services.operators.create_aggregate_conditions(args_dict: Dict[str, str]) → Dict[str, str | None] | None[source]¶

Creates aggregate conditions based on request arguments and the model’s columns.

Parameters:

args_dict – Dictionary of request arguments.

Returns:

A dictionary of aggregate conditions.

flask_scheema.services.operators.create_condition(table_name: str, column_name: str, operator: str, value: str, all_columns: Dict[str, Dict[str, Column]], base_model: Any) → Callable[source]¶

Converts a key-value pair from request arguments to a condition.

This version of the function accounts for joined tables.

Parameters:

  • table_name (str) – The table name.

  • column_name (str) – The column name.

  • operator (str) – The operator.

  • value (str) – The value associated with the key.

  • all_columns (Dict[str, Column]) – Dictionary of columns in the base model.

  • base_model (Any) – The base SQLAlchemy model.

Returns:

A condition function.

Return type:

Callable

Raises:

ValueError – If invalid operator or column is found in query params.

flask_scheema.services.operators.create_conditions_from_args(args_dict: Dict[str, str], base_model: DeclarativeBase, all_columns: Dict[str, Dict[str, Column]], join_models: Dict[str, DeclarativeBase]) → List[Callable][source]¶

Create filter conditions based on request arguments and model’s columns.

Parameters:

  • args_dict (Dict[str, str]) – Dictionary of request arguments.

  • base_model (DeclarativeBase) – The base SQLAlchemy model.

  • all_columns (Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]) – Nested dictionary of table names and their columns.

  • join_models (Dict[str, Any]) – Dictionary of join models.

Returns:

List of conditions to apply in the query.

Return type:

List[Callable]

Raises:

ValueError – If an invalid or ambiguous column name is provided.

Examples

‘id__eq’: 1 would return Addresses.id == 1 ‘account__eq’: ‘12345’ would return Addresses.account == ‘12345’ ‘account__in’: ‘12345,67890’ would return Addresses.account.in_([‘12345’, ‘67890’]) ‘account__like’: ‘12345’ would return Addresses.account.like(‘%12345%’) ‘[account__eq,id__eq]’: ‘12345,1’ would return (Addresses.account == ‘12345’) | (Addresses.id == 1)
